message.content:
cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.HC, cs.RO, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a novel approach to adjustable autonomy, which involves the transfer of decision-making control between agents and humans in multi-agent settings. This topic is closely related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and multi-agent systems (cs.MA). Additionally, the paper emphasizes the importance of considering human factors (cs.HC) and coordination constraints (cs.RO) in the design of transfer-of-control strategies. Finally, the paper presents a mathematical model and uses Markov Decision Processes to select an optimal strategy, which falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY).
